intro: Heldreichia bupleurifolia var. atalayi, commonly known as the Atalayi bellflower, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Turkey. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils and sunny to partially shaded conditions. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
